Archive for December, 2010

Former MSJC police chief sentenced to year in jail/SWRNN

Tuesday, December 28th, 2010

FYI

http://www.swrnn.com/southwest-riverside/2010-12-28/news/former-mt-san-jacinto-college-police-chief-sentenced-to-year-in-jail

“Former MSJC police Chief has been sentenced to a year in jail Tuesday after a motion to withdraw his guilty plea was rejected, said John Hall, a spokesman for Riverside County District Attorney Rod Pacheco.”

“Segawa was to begin serving his time immediately.  The case for the co-defendant McComas is still set for trial and the next court date is in February.  Investigators estimate McComas’ company may have earned as much as a half-million dollars from towing fees.”

http://www.pe.com/localnews/stories/PE_News_Local_D_esegawa29.11ae90d.html

“I think you violated a position of trust.  You’re right.  I hold you to a higher standard.”  Judge Helios J. Hernandez

Blog:

It is unfortunate that the administration did not act to fully investigate in depth the towing of vehicles when first informed, which was well before the DA arrived with a search warrant.

SJ Bus passes popular among college students/PE

Tuesday, December 28th, 2010

FYI

http://www.pe.com/localnews/stories/PE_News_Local_D_ebuspass28.d641e1.html

“MSJC students are trying out the bus as a way to get to college and other locations in a pilot program intended to introduce them to RTA busses as an alternate to private transportation.”

“The response has been positive across the board, particularly from the San Gorgonio Pass Area.”

Blog:

Providing bus passes for Pass students to attend the SJ campus offers students access to educational opportunity without a costly bond for a full-service campus. The current Banning “staging campus” and class offerings at both Pass area high schools can adequately meet student enrollment need until Pass enrollments meet and/or exceed the 500 FTE necessary to qualify for state capital construction and operational operational funds.  The Menifee campus has been built without local bond dollars.
